text: It's a really good breakfast place... the staff is nice and polite... the food is good....

Visiting Montreal for the first time and this casual diner was down the street from our Vacation rental. Service is EXCELLENT, food was wonderful! Staff was beyond kind and efficient!!! A definite must try!

Service was really good, but it was a bit let down by the food. The was nothing wrong with it (the food), but nothing great either.

This place is only open for breakfast and lunch, and has been around for a loooong time. The fare is standard Quebec-style (meat, beans, homefries), with the usual other options (french toast, pancakes, yoghurt, etc) but I was a bit let-down by the serving of homefries (potatoes) I got with mine.

If you're in the neighbourhood, and looking for breakfast, I'd recommend Chez Bédine just around the corner and up De l'Eglise.

Located in quiet Côte-St-Paul neighbourhood, Resto Mon-Real has been around for a while and it offers a solid breakfast and lunch menu for hungry girls and boys. The staff is friendly and courteous every time, and their espresso and café au lait are surprisingly satisfying.

I reside one corner away so I visit primarily out of convenience, but the food quality is consistent; if their Eggs Benedict are good enough for me to come back, it's usually a good sign.

I would give Mon-Real a solid 3.5 stars; it's good and convenient, yet it lacks a certain culinary flair required to rise above the competition. Since their present dinner formula has worked for them for so long, I do not expect them to change a thing. They seem to aim for safe and good, not fantastic, and I respect that.

Ahh, le beau jeu de mots! Ce petit resto de Ville-Émard n'est pas très loin de chez moi et j'y vois de temps en temps des Yelpeurs y faire leur « check-ins. » Vu le manque d'avis, je n'avais rien pour piquer ma curiosité et m'inciter à y aller jusqu'à ce que j'ai eu une envie d'un p'tit déjeuner bien ordinaire mais dans un nouvel endroit. C'est donc un beau dimanche matin (presque midi) qu'on a finalement découvert le Mon-Réal! Mon chum a pris le gros déjeuner (deux ufs, plein de viande, fèves au lard, crêpe et pain doré) et j'ai choisi la crêpe jambon-suisse qui a un nom tellement particulier que je ne m'en souviens plus! Les prix sont bien corrects et le service super! L'ambiance est quelque part entre resto familial et cantine. J'y retournerais certainement quand j'aurai le goût d'un déjeuner bien simple et que je veux faire changement des classiques de mon quartier.
